stephane.analysis.corr_functions¶

Functions

corr_d(M, frame[, indices, dlist, axes, p, ...])

Compute the correlation function in time at a given instant INPUT ----- M : Mdata object frame : int frame index indices : dict of 2 elements tuple (for both keys and values) pairs of coordinates that defines the distance of computation. Default value is None : compute the pair of indices directly dlist : list distances between points. defaut is None (goes with indices) axes : 2 element string list field names to be used p : int order of the correlation function OUTPUT ----- dlist : list of distances beetween points C : correlation function (un-normalized).

corr_d_stat(M, N[, indices, axes, p, average])

Compute the correlation function from an ensemble N of time

d_2pts_rand(u, d, N[, epsilon])

Return N pairs of indice points distant from d

get_indices(M[, N])

Compute N pairs of indices for increasing distances between points
